result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Sue Belford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kayla Sue Belford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kayla Sue Belford was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- 6 days credit against ultimate sentence.
- Sign up for probation by 8/16/22.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs. Payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County case 22CF156.
- $250 DNA Surcharge. Payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County case 22CF156.
- Complete Rule 25 or AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- No contact with Walmart in Hudson, WI.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Test randomly and regularly.

timeConds.notes:
- Conditional jail STAYED- to be used by the Agent if necessary.
- Huber authorized.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

9:03 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Kayla Sue Belford, Defendant Kayla Sue Belford in court. ADA Becker recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 - Possession of Methamphetamine. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Possession of Methamphetamine. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Cts 2 and 3. Sentencing arguments. 

Crt orders: 
Ct 1 - Possession of Methamphetamine
S/W 3 years probation with conditions:
- 3 months conditional jail - STAYED to be used by Agent if necessary - Huber authorized
- Complete Rule 25 or AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Test randomly and regularly
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs, except in a treatment setting
- No contact with Wal-Mart in Hudson, WI
- Court Costs $268
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250

6 days jail credit.
Defendant to report to probation today.
Adjourned: 9:33 AM. kma
Arraignment on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed by EFV on 07/15/22. arc   to rg

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Melissa Petersen appointed. mw
Pretrial assessment report. sealed. arc
Status conference on March 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

- Defendant to test clean before release. 

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  C.Carlson and Walmart.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:09 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF: Kayla Sue Belford appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Atty Harrelson waives prelim time limits. Court Sets STC. Adjourned  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
